member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadDataFilter.UpdateViewModel
member.summary: If the ItemProperties are ready -- go for it and create the ViewModel. If they are null, like often is the case with a DIC, the ViewModel will be created later when a PropertyChanged arrives that the ItemProperties have become available.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadDataFilter.OnItemPropertiesPropertyChanged(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Telerik.Windows.Data.ItemPropertyInfo})
member.summary: This method will be called only as a result of a DependencyProperty change callback of the ItemProperties property. The setter of the QueryableSource property should set the ItemProperties of the new QueryableSource without invoking the callback because the logic below is for unbound mode only. In other words, this method will be called when a user assigns ItemProperties when RadDataFilter is in unbound mode.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadDataFilter.CanUserCreateCompositeFilters
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can create composite filters. This property is typically used when filtering a DomainDataSource, which does not support filter composition.
member.value: true if filter composition is disabled; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets the filtered source.
member.remarks: Binding the ItemsSource property of an ItemsControl to the FilteredSource property will enable filtering for this control through RadDataFilter.

member.summary: Gets or sets the item properties used for creating filter conditions.
